properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 3:13AM AKST until February 2 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of up to 10 inches. The highest snowfall totals are expected
from Dillingham west. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph will
reduce visibilities to one half mile or less. The strongest
winds are expected along the coast.

* WHERE...North and west of King Salmon.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM AKST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
A winter weather advisory for snow and blowing snow means that
visibilities will be limited due to a combination of falling and
blowing snow. Use caution when traveling, especially in open
areas.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON NORTH AND WEST OF KING SALMON
